attributes.additional_details: So I call on the UK government to keep their hands off those powers!  They say it will be more expensive to have different sets of rules, but I don’t agree with them.  If they want a UK-wide framework, then maybe they could look towards having a federalised framework rather than a ‘power grab’.
attributes.background: In 1997, the people of Scotland voted very decisively to have a devolved Scottish Parliament and devolved powers as well, and they are within an EU framework.  But now, the UK government is planning a ‘power grab’ on these areas such as agriculture, farming and fishing.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking the UK Parliament not to make any changes to the current devolution arrangements, if that's what you'd like to happen.
